titleStmt.title: Prince Charles his summons sent to the Lord Admiral, to take down his standard, and come under his Highnesse obedience. And the Earl of Warwicks answer, and resolution to bear it still for the Parliament, against all opposition whatsoever. Also the proceedings of both navies to an ingagement and a list of the names of the members of both Houses of Parliament, the ministers, and others, that are to go to the Isle of Wight, on both sides, about the treaty with his Majesty for peace.
titleStmt.author: Charles II, King of England, 1630-1685.

titleStmt.title: Prince Charles his summons sent to the Lord Admiral, to take down his standard, and come under his Highnesse obedience. And the Earl of Warwicks answer, and resolution to bear it still for the Parliament, against all opposition whatsoever. Also the proceedings of both navies to an ingagement and a list of the names of the members of both Houses of Parliament, the ministers, and others, that are to go to the Isle of Wight, on both sides, about the treaty with his Majesty for peace.
titleStmt.author: Charles II, King of England, 1630-1685.
Warwick, Robert Rich, Earl of, 1587-1658.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for R. Smithurst, neer Pye-corner,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
